name: Existing dwellings – what should the retrofit standard be?
location: This stream will take place in (room to be confirmed)
description: Criticism of the Retrofit for the Future programme has tended to focus on costs and the extent to which targets can be achieved. The National Housing Federation’s guide, Managing the Assets suggests that reducing carbon emission by 60% costs half that of the 80% target, and is more appropriate when decarbonisation of the electricity grid and other factors such as replacement are taken into account. This seminar will look at what can be achieved at an affordable cost.

presentations.name: Looking at a wide range of dwellings – what would have to be done to get them to SAP 80 (proxy affordable warmth standard), or 60% emissions reduction? What would it cost? By how much would it reduce fuel costs and emissions?
presentations.speakers: Kathryn Derby, Senior Energy Consultant, Rickaby Thompson Associates

presentations.name: Retrofit in practice
presentations.speakers: Mark Elton, Associate Director, ECD Architects
